Change has been successfully rebased and submitted as e3fb95bf86bd5c874afdc1c7fc2e950d7a5e229a

Is there a "why" on this?  Might be nice for others to know the features provided by chrony.

Does this mean we're going to need phosphor-time-manager support for chrony also?

No, we are not going to need any phosphor-time-manager support for chrony. This doesn’t impact the time-manager code. The purpose of installing chrony in rootfs is to run chrony only in time server mode so that it can allow other BMC to obtain time from it. We don’t plan on exposing any redfish interfaces for chrony.
Done

We're trying to get away from these unrelated RDEPENDS to bring in new features. I think we should follow something like https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/openbmc/+/62509/ and create a DISTRO_FEATURE for this that we can then include in our huygens conf file.
Done, made use of DISTRO_FEATURE creation.
The commit message indicates they will run in parallel but this looks like it will just stop systemd-timesyncd? How do we ensure one starts before the other and we properly stop the one we want?
yes, I made a mistake there and my testing caught it. Changed the code accordingly which works.
nit: exceeds 72 chars
Done
Why can't we use the provided one out at https://gitlab.com/chrony/chrony/-/blob/master/examples/chronyd.service?ref_type=heads ? Could we do some overrides for our specific uses?

@Andrew, yes I did try to add only the override the `Conflicts:` property using the existing service file but there seems to be an issue in the systemd where a reset and override of dependencies is not possible. I had opened a systemd issue for the same. Once the systemd resolves the issue I will make the change of adding only the override.

Issue : https://github.com/systemd/systemd/issues/18154
Acknowledged
df-chrony
Done
Should be able to just make this "df-chrony" so anyone including the new .inc will get this installed in the meta-ibm layer.
Acknowledged
